intro: Morenia corallina, commonly known as the coral morelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Morenia corallina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
